caption: The Esplanade des Invalides is a vast and peaceful green space in the heart of Paris, offering stunning views of the H√¥tel des Invalides and its magnificent golden dome. It's a perfect spot for a leisurely stroll, picnic, or simply relaxing while taking in the surrounding historic architecture. The wide open lawns provide a serene atmosphere, and it's a great place to admire the grandeur of Paris. Located near major attractions like the Eiffel Tower and the Seine, the Esplanade des Invalides is a lovely escape from the hustle and bustle, blending history and tranquility.

The atmosphere was beautiful and intriguing while the service was warm and engaging. The cuisine was delightful with a playful wine list. What a delightful place to spend an evening. It is romantic, sophisticated yet relaxed and unassuming. I will be back!

This vast, open space in the heart of Paris is surrounded by beautiful gardens and historic buildings. The majestic H√¥tel des Invalides, with its striking golden dome, stands prominently in the background, adding to the area's charm. Walking along the esplanade, I enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere and the well-maintained lawns and paths. It‚Äôs a great spot to relax, take a leisurely stroll, or simply admire the impressive architecture and history around you.
Large oblong of open space, carpeted with grass and criss crossed by paths. The Seine on the Northern end and the majestic Invalides to the South.
Olimpic Games & Paralimpic Games. Nice to relax in you free time. Enjoy the restaurants and clubs near feom hear.
This is a huge green space with H√¥tel des Invalides at the top and looking down, is the magnificent Pont Alexandre III and the stunning grand and petit palais.

What a gorgeous place! The army museum is enormous but the most impressive was the dome with Napoleons tombe. We thought it was fearly cheap for the overall experience. there is so much to see in different parts of the building. It's close on Thursday so make sure that you will not plan visit on Thursday.

Interesting place, with an exquisite entrance gate and old cannons and other military equipment around. Lovely greenery and architecture and beautiful road leading to the gate with golden figures on monuments on the side of the road!
Extremely big! Too big to explore in one day. It pack of war history, outfit, tools and several stuff.
Definitely a must see historical attraction. No wait, plenty to see, reasonable price (kids free). And not too far from Eiffel Tower.
A great place to visit, very walkable and close to other places of interest. Need a couple of hours to have a good look at what is there.
Beautiful architecture. Must visit
Magnificent. The huge open area provides beautiful views of surrounding historic buildings and a venue for people to rest and relax
Amazing location and tourist attraction. Definitely need to des it while you are in Paris

I visited the place a little later in the evening just before the lights came on. It looked like a magnificent building without the lights on, but when the lights were turned on it was a completely new place. It looked so much ago. There are some places for people to sit around and relax. I would definitely recommend people to check this out after the lights are turned on.

Gorgeous area, with spectacular views in all directions. Definitely worth a little detour to take in this site
Amazing visait to the invalid√©s war museum and esplanade filled with helicopters.  At the end the pilots climbed in and took them home in front of everyone!  Amazing!
Comfortable place to lie down in the summer. Just get a bottle of wine and some cheese and bread! The views are amazing and you‚Äôll have a lot of french company. Watch for dog poop in the grass.
Beautiful place and environment
This beautiful lawn is located between Pont Alexandre III and Mus√©e de l'Arm√©e. It is open for public for free. When visited yesterday, there was an art event supporting the life of dolphins.
Great visit, do not be afraid to walk.

Beautiful, historic spot for any tourist. One can have a nice picnic on a beautiful day. Some areas are dedicated for rollers skating. There are days when groups of people gather there to danse and perform some acts. I recommend

The Esplanade des Invalides is the area between the Alexandre III bridge, over the Seine River, and the buildings of the military museums and the Domo dos Invalides, which guards Napoleon's sarcophagus.
Park in a front of this building is full of life, golden dome behind a place is also gorgeous, inner park has lits of rabbits.
Beautiful palace and green area to sit and relax....
Nice little park next to the Army museum.
Nice building
A nice place for a stroll. It really uses the Hospital Des Invalides in the backdrop well.
This place is similarly beautiful than sourroundings of Eiffel tower. Nice garden around.
You can sit in the grass and talk to any group next to yours. Everyone is polite and welcome you. The view is relaxing even at night!
Nice but couldn't find the supposed bunnies
Good place to spend time with friends in a green zone inside the city. Sometimes you can find people playing soccer
Nice to walk and look at invalids and army museum in distance.  Main road runs all round.  Some flower beds in the middle were magnificent

The Esplanade des Invalides is a 250 m wide and open lawn area on the north side of the Hotel des Invalides that spreads to the Seine River. You will have a wide and unobstructed view of H√¥tel National des Invalides Army Museum from the Esplanade des Invalides. The French Foreign Ministry and the home office of Air France are also located around this Esplanade des Invalides. You can view the invalid on one side and the Alexander Bridge on the other side from this great place.

The Esplanade des Invalides is the area between the Alexandre III bridge, over the Seine River, and the buildings of the military museums and the Domo dos Invalides, which guards Napoleon's sarcophagus.  These are buildings built in the 18th and 19th centuries.
Awesome place... Green grace can spend the whole day playing there with friends, family &Pets
